messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RE:unschooling-dotcom egg allergies-help please!
messages.msgSnippet: Dawn, Thank you!  Gosh, I wish I could go back and change some of these things with both my boys! I do have to say that neither one of them has ever been sick
messages.messageBody:
Dawn,

Thank you! Gosh, I wish I could go back and change some of these things
with both my boys! I do have to say that neither one of them has ever been
sick other than an occasional cold which lasts only a short period of time.
We feel that our chiropractor has helped out a lot in this area! Thanks
again!

Michelle

>From: dawn <dawn@...>
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RE:unschooling-dotcom egg
>allergies-help please!
>Date: Tue, 7 Mar 2000 05:53:09 -0800 (PST)
>
>I agree withthe below advice. I have one allergic son (who btw is greatly
>improved over the years) and one who shows no signs of allergies. I am
>allergic, my husband is allergic and his family has a LONG history of what
>can only be undiagnosed food allergies (I'm adopted and have no family
>medical history), all of his sister's kids have allergies. With our
>second son (the unallergic) we postponed all solids until the middle of
>hte second year, dairy for longer, eggs even longer, and soy even longer.
>He has had no vaccinations. He has also NEVER been sick, besides viral
>things that go around town, like the flu this winter (his was the
>shortest, lightest case) and has never been seen by a dr for illness. I
>know that a case study of one is not statistically significant, but he
>also has none of the asthma that plagues me and my other son or any of the
>skin problems that plague my husband and his side of the family.
>
>
>dawn h-s, Mama to two wonderful boyz
>
>
>On Tue, 7 Mar 2000, Sonia Ulan wrote:
>
> > From: Sonia Ulan <sulan@...>
> >
> > Just a hint, I've learned from experience: Breast-feed as long as you
> > possibly can and seriously consider NOT vaccinating. Your baby will
> > receive most of his/her immunological benefit from being nursed.
> > You might also postpone feeding solids as long as you can and even then
> > stick to vegetables. No peanut butter for 2 years as one allergic
> > reaction can often signal other sensitivities.
> >
> > Michelle Bennett wrote:
> > >
> > > From: "Michelle Bennett" <mlb_2boymom@...>
> > >
> > > Can anyone recommend some good books to read about food allergies? My
>baby
> > > has just had two severe reactions to egg yolks! I am wanting to learn
>all I
> > > possibly can about this-possible causes, outgrowing it, allergy vs.
> > > intolerance, foods to avoid, vaccines, etc.
> > >
> > > Michelle
> > >
> > > >From: "Michelle Bennett" <mlb_2boymom@...>
> > > >Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
> > > >To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
> > > >Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] wipe boards
> > > >Date: Mon, 06 Mar 2000 18:52:54 EST
> > > >
> > > >nailpolish remover-used it all the time in the classroom
> > > >
> > > >Michelle
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > >From: "A. Yates" <hooperck@...>
> > > > >Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
> > > > >To: Unschooling <Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com>
> > > > >Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] wipe boards
> > > > >Date: Sun, 05 Mar 2000 22:44:29 -0500
> > > > >
> > > > >Here is a weird question....
> > > > >What do you clean one of those magic marker wipe off boards with
>when
> > > > >the marker won't come off. We used the right kind of marker, but
>after
> > > > >awhile, they don't erase very much.
> > > > >????
> > > > >Ann
> > > > >
> > > >
> > > >______________________________________________________
> > > >Get Your Private, Free Email at http://www.hotmail.com
> > > >
> > >
> > > ______________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RE:unschooling-dotcom egg allergies-help please!
messages.msgSnippet: Sonia, Thank you for all the helpful advice!  I am definitely checking out all the immunizations!  I didn t give my oldest peanut butter until two also! Thanks
messages.messageBody:
Sonia,

Thank you for all the helpful advice! I am definitely checking out all the
immunizations! I didn't give my oldest peanut butter until two also!
Thanks again!

Michelle

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RE:unschooling-dotcom egg allergies-help please!
messages.msgSnippet: Amy, Thanks again for the suggested book and organizations!!! I m going to the library tomorrow! Michelle ...
messages.messageBody:
Amy,

Thanks again for the suggested book and organizations!!! I'm going to the
library tomorrow!

Michelle

>From: "K WORTHEN" <kworthen@...>
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
>To: <Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com>
>CC: <kworthen@...>
>Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RE:unschooling-dotcom egg
>allergies-help please!
>Date: Mon, 6 Mar 2000 21:26:48 -0500
>
>Sorry Lisa, I think the last link I sent you is for respitory allergies.
>Probably won't be much help. You could also try to find the book Tracking
>Down Hidden Food Allergies (don't know the author off hand). It's an old
>book ( probably out of print now), but you might be able to get it via the
>library or a used book store. I also found LaLeche Leage to be a good
>source
>of info and support.
>Amy
>----- Original Message -----
>From: "Lisa Bugg" <LisaBugg@...>
>To: <Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com>
>Sent: Monday, March 06, 2000 7:48 PM
>Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RE:unschooling-dotcom egg allergies-help
>please!
>
>
> > From: "Lisa Bugg" <LisaBugg@...>
> >
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > > Can anyone recommend some good books to read about food allergies? My
> > baby
> > > has just had two severe reactions to egg yolks! I am wanting to learn
>all
> > I
> > > possibly can about this-possible causes, outgrowing it, allergy vs.
> > > intolerance, foods to avoid, vaccines, etc.
> > >
> > > Michelle
> >
> > "Is This Your Child, by Doris Rapp is one of the best IMHO. I've used
>it
>as
> > a reference for years.
> >
> > LisaKK

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RE:unschooling-dotcom egg allergies-help please!
messages.msgSnippet: Amy, Thank you for the information!  I will definitely check out the website.  I had already read about the tests being inconclusive.  I wasn t planning on
messages.messageBody:
Amy,

Thank you for the information! I will definitely check out the website. I
had already read about the tests being inconclusive. I wasn't planning on
trying the allergist route just yet. Thanks again!

Michelle

>From: "K WORTHEN" <kworthen@...>
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com

>Date: Mon, 6 Mar 2000 20:59:15 -0500
>
>Lisa,
> The address for the Food Allergy Network is www.foodallergy.org. You
>may also want to check out www.aanma.org and
>http://www.allergylearninglab.com I hope this helps. Good Luck.
>Amy
>p.s. I appologize to everyone again for the double posts. Does anyone know
>how to fix that?
>----- Original Message -----
